road: parallel lines or edges that define its boundaries
being a travel route for vehicles
having a contrasting color or texture compared to surrounding environment
having a horizon or vanishing point
sidewalk: often raised above the surrounding terrain
may have a curb or barrier separating it from the road
may have a smooth or textured surface
may have a specific pattern or design
building: structure with walls, windows, and doors
roof, chimney, or other architectural features
exterior materials such as brick, concrete, wood, or metal
presence of doors, windows, and other openings
may have a foundation or base
can be attached to other buildings or standalone
wall: connected to a building or a fence
made of materials such as brick, concrete, wood, or metal
may have visible joints or seams
can be plain or have decorations such as paint, wallpaper, or tiles
fence: horizontal or diagonal beams or wires
connects to walls, buildings, or other structures
made of wood, metal, or other materials
pole: may have attachments such as lights, signs, or wires
often standing alone or connected to a structure
traffic light: vertical or horizontal mount on a pole or mast
three colored lights: red, yellow, and green
wires or cables connecting the light to a power source
traffic sign: mounted on a pole or hung from a gantry
text, symbols, or images providing information or instruction
often has a distinctive border or frame
vegetation: various shapes and sizes of leaves or branches
growth on or near the ground
varying textures, from smooth to rough or prickly
can be grouped together in clusters or patterns
may have visible stems, trunks, or roots
terrain: presence of rocks, soil, sand, or other geological materials
sometimes covered with vegetation, water, or other natural elements
often without man-made structures or objects
sky: often appears as the top portion of the image
may contain clouds, sun, or moon
may have a gradient of colors, from light to dark
does not have defined edges or boundaries
person: head with facial features such as eyes, nose, and mouth
skin tone varying from pale to dark
hair on the head, which can be various colors and styles
clothing that can be diverse in style, color, and texture
shoes or other footwear on the feet
hands that can hold objects or make gestures
rider: wearing a helmet and protective gear (optional)
focusing on the road or path ahead
car: a rectangular or curved body with a horizontal hood and trunk
a shine or reflection indicating metal or glass surfaces
truck: often with an open cargo bed
may have a separate cabin or cab for the driver
typically has a flat front end with a grille and headlights
often has larger wheels and a higher ground clearance than a car
may display a company logo or branding
bus: a front grille with a logo or design
a distinct separation between the driver's cabin and the passenger area
a door for passengers to enter and exit
train: doors and windows on the cars
a locomotive with a control cabin
a distinctive shape and size compared to other vehicles
motorcycle: a chain or belt drive connecting the engine to the rear wheel
bicycle: two wheels connected by a frame
a seat and handlebars for the rider
a chain or gear system connecting the pedals to the wheels
brakes and gear shifters on the handlebars
